content.question: Lines 6-7 (me . . . erit) tell us that

choices.label: no one will receive the speaker’s help with theft
no one, not even the speaker, should become a slave’s advocate
no one thinks a minister will ever be a thief
no one will be angry if the speaker comes to his aid

content.answer: no one will receive the speaker’s help with theft

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
